intro: Anthyllis onoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow pea-like flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several narrow, linear leaflets. Anthyllis onoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
